summary:
High Motivated Leader with extensive experience in the design and installation of advanced industrial automation assembly, warehouse & production equipment/machinery in a variety of industries, including biopharmaceuticals, automotive, energy, and food and beverage, as well as comprehensive technical project management, Innovation Management, people management, and lead technical engineer for various advanced technological equipment. Capable of responding swiftly and effectively to ever-changing environments and situations in order to meet critical project deadlines. Capable of working and collaborating at all levels of the organization, as well as motivating and mentoring diverse professional and highly competent engineering teams, while leading by example as an individual contributor.

"I believe that the correct direction and mentorship encourages true Innovation leaders to take action and use their knowledge to teach others while also developing themselves on the journey."

projects.title: Macroscopic 3-D measurements with the innovative depth scanning Fringe projection technique (DSFP) (NI Vision, NI Max, Zemax, Matlab )
projects.description: depth scanning fringe projection technique on the basis of triangulation Principle for the 3-D measurement of a macroscopic scene. The stage can be determined for any desired depth range of the measurement volume. Additionally, the known limitations of the depth of focus striking by light projection techniques will be overcome. During the measurement procedure, an illuminated Ronchi Test in front of a projection lens is moved both in z and x-directions by two vertically arranged linear translation phases. These results in an oblique shift of the projected grating, resulting in an oblique scan of the projected fringe pattern in the measurement volume i.e. the object space. For a well-focused image acquisition, a CCD camera placed on the same z-stage in front of an observation lens takes a series of images of the scene in different z-positions. This focusing allows the use of large apertures and therefore a better exploitation of light. In our assembled sensor, the triangulation Principle basis of 115 mm nearly corresponds to the distance of a person’s pupils. We used MATLAB for unwrapping phase distribution to real world 3D coordinates.

projects.title: Analysis of Transient Stability Using MATLAB/Simulink in  a Modern Power System
projects.description:
- A WSCC 3 Machine 9 Bus system has been considered for this project.
- A MATLAB/Simulink model has been developed for the system to analyse the Transient Stability.
- The fault locations in the power systems are identified with this model.
- Newton Raphson Method, Swing Equation, etc.,
- usage of any controllers can be used as extension for the project to study the behavior of the system stability.

contributors.headline: Technology Strategist | Architect | Innovation Researcher" Industry 4.0 & IoT/IIoT, Machine Learning, AI & CV, Robotics, Digital Transformation Enthusiast"
Electrical Engineer at Hexad Solutions Group

projects.title: Application of MATLAB/SIMULINK for the Analysis of Multi-Machine Transient Stability of a Power System.
projects.description: This project we have taken a multi machine power system as an example to demonstrate the scope and features of a Simulink based model for transient stability analysis. A self-sufficient model has been developed with full details, which can work as a basic structure for an advanced and detailed study. The effects of Excitation controller and speed governing systems have also been demonstrated and any additional controllers can be incorporated very easily for any desired accuracy.

profile_positions.description:
- Responsible for driving the company's approach to automation and innovation. 
- Lead cross-functional teams globally to evaluate concepts and conduct analysis, pilots and implementations.
- Manage the company's global investment budget for automation and innovation.
- Manage engineering resources (both direct and indirect) to evaluate concepts and perform automation/innovation cost/benefit analysis for specific operations.
- Ensure disciplined project management of implementations across multiple functions in Operations, Engineering, Procurement, Sales, Human Resources and Customers. 
- Automation & Innovation Program Manager for a portfolio of implementations, coordinating with project managers while serving as technical project lead for several new implementations of Industrie 4.0 and IIoT warehouse automation technologies.
- Liaison with key customers in evaluating concepts and implementations, including serving as lead DP world contract logistics representative to the customer's management team on progress with automation and innovation initiatives.
- Development and supporting Key SRM Programs.
- Develop and execute marketing activities around the company's automation and innovation program, including use of social media and thought leadership in trade publications and conferences.

-	Shaping ideas into concrete, robust, and appropriate architectures, and transition plans for implementation.
-	Ensure quality guidelines and control processes are created and implemented for technology platforms and products.

-	Lead investigations and develop technical solutions to complex problems requiring regular use of ingenuity and creativity.
-	Develop technologies and ensure the organization has the right skills to build technology capabilities in the right way.
-	Consolidation of knowledge Ensuring that knowledge is embedded in the organization.

and semantic segmentation. It requires developing novel algorithms and understanding how to apply existing methodologies to solve given domain-specific problems.

        other techniques.

profile_positions.title: Laser  Application and Process Development Engineer

profile_positions.description: The selective laser etching (ISLE - In the volume selective laser etching) is a new method for creating microfluidic or micro components in transparent dielectrics. Using ultra-short pulsed laser beam of great intensity, portions to be modified in the dielectric, in a subsequent etching bath having large etching rates. A consistent explanation of the physical processes in the material is not given. One approach is to study the thermal processes in the structuring of dielectrics.
